content.title: Theoretical Minimum Electric Charge
content.abstract: The elementary charge e is the smallest free electric charge in nature due to charge quantization and quark confinement, making this one of the most well-established theoretical minimum values in physics.

theoretical_minimum.name: Elementary charge
theoretical_minimum.status: PROVEN - well-established minimum for free charges

why_charge_is_quantized.explanation: If magnetic monopoles exist, then eg = nℏc/2, requiring charge quantization.
why_charge_is_quantized.formula: q = n·e where n is integer

why_charge_is_quantized.explanation: In the Standard Model, charge quantization follows from cancellation of gauge anomalies.
why_charge_is_quantized.implication: Electron and proton charges must be exactly equal and opposite

why_charge_is_quantized.explanation: GUTs naturally explain charge quantization by embedding U(1) in non-abelian group.
why_charge_is_quantized.example: In SU(5), Q = T₃ + Y/2 automatically quantizes

quarks.explanation: Quarks carry fractional charges but are always confined in hadrons with integer total charge.

quark_confinement.mechanism: QCD color force increases with distance (asymptotic freedom inverse)
quark_confinement.result: Only integer multiples of e observed as free particles
quark_confinement.experimental_verification: Extensive searches find no free fractional charges (to ~10⁻²⁰ e precision)

free_charge_minimum.explanation: All free particles have charges that are integer multiples of e

theoretical_exceptions.description: In 2D systems, fractional statistics and effective fractional charges can appear
theoretical_exceptions.example: Fractional quantum Hall effect: e* = e/3, e/5, etc.

theoretical_exceptions.description: Would carry magnetic charge g = ℏc/(2e) (Dirac monopole)
Some BSM theories predict particles with charge εe where ε << 1

comparison_with_planck_charge.insight: Planck charge is LARGER than elementary charge by factor ~12

experimental_verification.precision: Electron charge known to 10⁻⁹ relative uncertainty
experimental_verification.quark_searches: Upper limit on free fractional charges: < 10⁻²⁰ e
